caption.p: Principle coordinates analysis of general (blue diamonds) and survivor (orange squares) trees. (A) Pinus albicaulis. The first and second coordinates explain 19.29 and 13.67% of the variation among trees, respectively (total 33%). (B) Pinus contorta. The first and second coordinates explain 10.98 and 10.55% of the variation among trees, respectively (total 21.5%). Ellipses surround general population trees that clustered with survivors in the neighbor-joining tree ( Figure 1 for P. albicaulis, Figure 4 for P. contorta) and correspond to trees marked with an arrow in the STRUCTURE analysis (in this figure). Arrow indicates one general population tree within the ellipse that did not cluster with survivors in the neighbor-joining tree.
